means: 使士气低落，使意志消沉( demoralize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The ship's crew were now exhausted and utterly demoralized.
sentence.Network_cn: 这艘船上的船员现在都已精疲力竭，彻底丧失了信心。

sentence.Network_en: They have left the teaching profession, demoralized and undervalued.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们已经离开了教学行业，意志消沉，受人轻视。

sentence.Network_en: The army was demoralized by defeat.
sentence.Network_cn: 这支军队因败北而士气低落.

PerfectNetExp.abs: mountaincat的英语... ... denticle 小齿;小齿状突起 demoralized 意志消沉 sort by size 是什么意思鸣金收兵,吹号收兵,下令撤退.
The army was demoralized by defeat ., 军队因战败而士气消沉.
the rejection can leave you demoralized .拒绝会让你失去斗志。

all of this indicates that so far there has been no breakthrough for the coalition ; Iraqi troops are not demoralized and the Iraqi command is still in control of its forces .所有这些表明，到目前为止联军并没有取得突破；伊拉克部队没有丧失斗志，伊拉克指挥部仍然控制着它的军队。

list.abs: do not forgive their iniquity and let not their sin be blotted out before You , for they have demoralized the builders .尼4:5不要遮掩他们的罪孽、不要使他们的罪恶从你面前涂抹．因为他们在修造的人眼前惹动你的怒气。
Constant criticism is enough demoralize anybody ., 频繁的批评足以使任何人意志消沉.

list.exp: 丧失自信心、削弱勇气或志气的话语
list.abs: sàngqìhuà[demoralizing word] 丧失自信心、削弱勇气或志气的话语丧权辱国
the rejection can leave you demoralized .拒绝会让你失去斗志。

entry.tran: 使士气低落;使失去信心;使泄气
entry.def: If something demoralizes someone, it makes them lose so much confidence in what they are doing that they want to give up.

example.ex: Clearly, one of the objectives is to demoralize the enemy troops in any way they can.
example.tran: 很明显，目标之一就是要用一切可能的手段打击敌军的士气。

sentences.sentence: "felt discouraged by the magnitude of the problem"
"the disheartened instructor tried vainly to arouse their interest"

auth_sentence.content: The Rabelaisian Strauss-Kahn left a demoralized institution of 2, 500 economists, policy advisors and the like.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Rabelaisian Strauss-Kahn left a demoralized institution of 2, 500 economists, policy advisors and the like.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Rabelaisian Strauss-Kahn left a demoralized institution of 2, 500 economists, policy advisors and the like.

auth_sentence.content: He said the "officer corps is demoralized, " with generals and hundreds of other officers jailed with no indictments in sight.
auth_sentence.res_content: He said the "officer corps is demoralized, " with generals and hundreds of other officers jailed with no indictments in sight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He said the "officer corps is demoralized, " with generals and hundreds of other officers jailed with no indictments in sight.
